channel.title: Interleaved RSS Feed
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from each RSS source, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Russian Official in Kursk Declares State of Emergency as Ukraine Advances
item.description: The local government in Russia declared a state of emergency as military analysts reported that Ukrainian forces had advanced several miles across the border.

item.title: Russian Official in Kursk Declares State of Emergency as Ukraine Advances
item.description: The local government in Russia declared a state of emergency as military analysts reported that Ukrainian forces had advanced several miles across the border.

item.title: July was the first month in over a year that didn’t set a heat record
item.description: It is the second-warmest July and second-warmest of any month recorded in the agency's records, behind only July 2023.

item.title: Judge Kamala Harris on the Merits — Not Which Box She Checks
item.description: Stop all the talk of breaking barriers and glass ceilings.

item.title: Israel Vows It Is Prepared for Retaliatory Attacks
item.description: As Iran and Hezbollah prepare to respond to twin assassinations last week, Israel’s military chief says the country is at “peak readiness,” and its prime minister warns that Israel will “exact a heavy price for any act of aggression.”

item.title: Italy doubles its ‘billionaires tax’ to €200,000 for super-rich expats
item.description: 1,186 high-net-worth individuals have transferred their tax residency to Italy since the policy was first introduced in 2017.

item.title: How Anti-Immigrant Riots Flared in the U.K.
item.description: A far-right movement fueled by disinformation has brought fear and violence to cities across England and in Northern Ireland. That has in turn prompted counterprotests.

item.title: The Toll of 10 Months of Simmering Conflict on the Israel-Lebanon Border
item.description: Satellite data shows the devastation the conflict between Israel and Hezbollah militants has left on both sides of the border.

item.title: Hyundai debuts a new EV facility in Thailand, as the ‘Detroit of Asia’ pivots to making electric cars
item.description: The Korean carmaker is pushing into Thailand right as Chinese EVs are starting to pull ahead of Japanese brands.

item.title: The Campaign for the Midwest, and Antiracism Demonstrations in the U.K.
item.description: Plus, a Hawaiian town debates how to rebuild.

item.title: How Anti-Immigrant Riots Flared in the U.K.
item.description: A far-right movement fueled by disinformation has brought fear and violence to cities across England and in Northern Ireland. That has in turn prompted counterprotests.

item.title: Jamie Dimon is done psychoanalyzing the Fed
item.description: "Every day 325 million Americans go to work, go to their jobs, take care of their families, take care of their kids, build out their house, change a job. And it could be affected by the Fed changing rates by 50 base points? I don't think so."

item.title: U.K. Officials Express Relief After Far-Right Riots Fail to Materialize
item.description: The authorities had been braced for further violence after anti-immigrant demonstrations in previous days had descended into riots.

item.title: Muhammad Yunus Set to Lead Bangladesh Temporarily
item.description: Muhammad Yunus, who is to lead the country temporarily, landed in Dhaka and appealed to the nation for calm. He faces the daunting task of restoring order.

item.title: 75% of carry trade blamed in recent stock meltdown has been unwound, JPMorgan says
item.description: The carry strategy — which involves borrowing at low rates to fund purchases in higher-yielding assets elsewhere — has been wobbling for months.
